lines.gurmukhi: kwm kRoD loB moh AhMmyv kY AswD swD sq Drm dieAw rQ sMqoK kY
lines.transliteration_english: Kaam Krodh Lobh Moh Ahanmayv Kai Asaadha , Saadh Sat Dharam Daiaa Rad Santokh Kai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Self-willed persons remain engrossed in vices like lust, anger, greed, attachment, pride, whereas Guru-conscious persons are kind, sympathetic and contented.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq swDsMg BwvnI Bgiq Bwie durmiq kY AswD sMg duK doK kY
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmati Saadhasang Bhaavanee Bhagati Bhaai , Duramati Kai Asaadh Sang Doukh Dokh Kai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: In the company of saintly persons, one attains faith, love and devotion; whereas in the company of base and fake people, one gets pain, suffering and base wisdom.

lines.gurmukhi: jnm mrn gur crn srin ibnu moK pd crn kml icq coK kY
lines.transliteration_english: Janam Maran Gur Charan Sarani Binu , Mokh Pad Charan Kamal Chit Chokh Kai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Without the refuge of the True Guru self-oriented persons fall in the cycle of birth and death. Obedient Sikhs of the Guru drink deep the nectar of Guru's words, imbibe them in their heart and thus achieve salvation.

lines.gurmukhi: igAwn AMs hMs giq gurmuiK bMs ibKY dukiRq sukiRq KIr nIr soK poK kY ]287]
lines.transliteration_english: Giaan Ans Hans Gati Gurmukhi Bans Bikhai , Doukrit Soukrit Kheer Neer Sokh Pokh Kai ?287?

Shabad OS B.translation: In the clan of Guru-conscious persons, knowledge is clean and invaluable like swans. Just as a swan is capable of separating milk from water, so do the Guru-oriented Sikhs discard all that is base and feel satiated with superior deeds. (287)
